page.title: 14TRANSPORT _ CHIGNALS
page.content: Transport in the area of MASHBURY is not well developed. There is no bus service, national or private. People have to walk to bus stops around Chignal Smealy or use their own transport. Around the centre of CHIGNAL SMEALY there is a bus service which runs four times weekly along a minor road to Chelmsford. A Eastern National bus service is to the south of the area along the A414. A school bus runs daily along the road by Chignal Hall to the nearest school outside the area. There is a private bus service to and from Chelmsford twice a week. The roads around the area of Chignal Smealy and Mashbury are all minor roads their condition is variable. Private cars are the most common form of transport.
